item.title: Federal Reserve's Mester: Policy Rate May Need to Be Adjusted If Labor Market Risks Worsen
item.description: On August 23rd, Mohamed El-Erian of the Federal Reserve stated that the emphasis should be placed on the entire interest rate path rather than just the rate decision of a specific meeting. Inflation has been above the target level, and there are ongoing risks. The next employment report may be sufficient to demonstrate the need for a rate cut or it may not, depending on the specific details of the report. The Fed's policy will be moderately tightened. More data is required, and the rate outlook will continue to be revised until the September meeting. The risks in the labor market are increasing but have not yet become actual. It is expected that the inflationary impact of tariffs will gradually diminish. The rate path may involve a pause in rate cuts. If the risks in the labor market escalate, the policy rate may need to be adjusted. (FX678)

item.title: Radiant Capital's hacker sold 3931 ETH in the past 2 hours, realizing profits
item.description: August 23rd. According to on-chain data analyst Yu Jin, in the past two hours, the Radiant Capital hacker sold 3,931 ETH at a price of $4,726 and exchanged it for 18.57 million DAI. The hacker's multiple swing trades are as follows:· Last year, after stealing $53 million, they bought 21,900 ETH at a price of $2,420 for storage;· On August 14th, they sold 9,631 ETH at a price of $4,562;· On August 20th, they bought 4,914 ETH at a price of $4,167;· Today, they sold 3,931 ETH at a price of $4,726.The cryptocurrency worth $53 million stolen by the hacker last year is now valued at $104 million, including 13,300 ETH (approximately $62.63 million) and 42.03 million DAI.

item.title: Yesterday, the U.S. Bitcoin Spot ETF saw a net outflow of $23.2 million, while the BlackRock IBIT had a net outflow of $198.8 million.
item.description: On August 23rd, as monitored by Farside Investors, yesterday the net outflow of the U.S. Bitcoin spot ETF was $23.2 million. The details are as follows:BlackRock IBIT: -$1.988 billionFidelity FBTC: +$50.9 millionBitwise BITB: +$12.7 millionARK ARKB: +$65.7 millionFranklin EZBC: +$13.5 millionVanEck HODL: +$26.4 millionGrayscale GBTC: +$6.4 million

item.title: Yesterday's US Ethereum Spot ETF saw a net inflow of $337 million
item.description: On August 23rd, as monitored by Farside Investors, yesterday the net inflow of the U.S. Ethereum spot ETF was 337 million USD. This included:- BlackRock ETHA: + 109.4 million USD- Fidelity FETH: + 117.9 million USD- Bitwise ETHW: + 36.3 million USD- Franklin EZET: + 5.5 million USD- Grayscale ETHE: + 45.9 million USD- Grayscale Mini ETH: + 22.7 million USD

item.title: After 3 years of dormancy, a certain whale address transferred 3500 BTC, realizing a profit of $305 million.
item.description: On August 23rd, as per the monitoring of LookOnChain, a whale address that had been dormant for 3 years transferred 3,500 BTC (approximately $408 million) to a new address 10 hours ago.Three years ago, this address withdrew 3,500 BTC from Gemini. At that time, the value was approximately $103 million, with an average withdrawal price of $29,620. As a result, it achieved a profit of $305 million (+294%).

item.title: 「Bitcoin Ancient Whale」 sold another 300 BTC to increase their ETH position 1 hour ago
item.description: August 23rd. As per the monitoring of LookOnChain, a whale or institution that has held 10,606 BTC for 7 years has achieved a profit of $1.12 billion. One hour ago, they once again transferred 300 BTC (approximately $34.86 million) to sell on Hyperliquid with the intention of switching to ETH.Currently, they hold a long position of 135,265 ETH (approximately $581 million), with an average entry price of $4,295, indicating a profit of $58 million. They purchased 122,226 ETH (approximately $535 million) in spot transactions at an average price of $4,377, realizing a profit of $42 million.

item.title: 「$125,000 ETH Long Position Liquidation」 Whale Once on the Verge of Liquidation but Did Not Reduce Position
item.description: On August 23rd, as monitored by on-chain data analyst Yu Jin, the "125k USD Long ETH Liquidation" whale was on the verge of liquidation during the recent pullback, with a liquidation price of 4666.6 USD. Nevertheless, the lowest price on Hyperliquid during the recent dip was 4667.5 USD. The trader did not reduce their position and is currently sitting on an unrealized profit of 3.02 million USD.

item.title: The US Ethereum Spot ETF's total assets under management have surpassed $30 billion for the first time, with the holdings representing 5.36% of the circulating supply.
item.description: On August 23rd, based on the data from strategicethreserve, the total scale of the US Ethereum spot ETF has reached over 30 billion US dollars for the first time. At the time of writing, it has reached 6.48 million ETH (approximately 30.37 billion US dollars), accounting for 5.36% of the total Ethereum circulation.

item.title: Tom Lee: Ethereum Market Cap Has a High Probability of Surpassing Bitcoin
item.description: On August 23rd, Tom Lee, the newly appointed Chairman of the Board of BitMine, stated in an interview: "I think there is a very high possibility, perhaps as high as 50%, that Ethereum's market capitalization will exceed Bitcoin's."

item.title: ETH/BTC rose to 0.0418 this morning, marking a 135% cumulative increase from the April 22nd low.
item.description: On August 23rd, based on HTX market data, with Ethereum reaching a new all-time high this morning, the ETH/BTC exchange rate also rose to a high of 0.0418, returning to the level it last saw in December of last year. It has surged by 135% from the low on April 22nd and is currently trading at 0.0405.
